task.title: Setting Channel Properties
task.shortdesc: The channel properties can be configured using the CSensrvChannel::SetProperty() function.

prereq.p: Before setting channel properties, you must open the sensor channel.

step.cmd: Create a TSensrvProperty property object for setting the KSensrvPropIdDataRate property using the TSensrvProperty(const TSensrvPropertyId,const TInt,const TInt) constructor.
Set the KSensrvPropIdDataRate property value by passing the property object that you created to CSensrvChannel::SetProperty().

example.p: The following example explains how to set the x-axis of accelerometer channel status from activated to deactivated.

The axis active property KSensrvPropIdAxisActive is first retrieved using the CSensrvChannel::GetPropertyL() function. If the axis is active, the new deactivated value is set in the retrieved property object. Then the channel is updated with this updated property object by using the CSensrvChannel::SetProperty() function.

postreq.p: End the session with the sensor channel using the CSensrvChannel::CloseChannel() function.
